channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: YAPC::EU::2012 Call for Speakers
item.description: YAPC::Europe will take place between 20-22 August, in Frankfurt. You are invited to submit talks already.

item.title: Perl Data Language (PDL) 2.4.10 Release
item.description: .... This reminds me if we could marry Padre with PDL, that could be an interesting step towards providing an alternative to Matlab.

item.title: Brocade Execs Offer Look Under OpenScript Engine's Hood
item.description: I especially liked the part: 'Basically, we ported the Perl programming language to the ADX application processor so that you can use APIs to control application delivery with a script. This means you get all the Perl goodness that you know and love for writing custom scripts to read or write layer three to seven headers based on your particular application needs.'

item.title: 2012Q1 Grant Proposals
item.description: Alberto Simões announced 3 grant proposals that were submitted to TPF. Please check them out and comment on them.

item.title: Announcing the third e-book of Peteris Krumins 'Perl One-Liners Explained'
item.description: It contains 111 pages and explains 130 unique one-liners and I already bought it.

item.title: A Perl lexer and parser for Graphviz dot files
item.description: Ron Savage announced GraphViz2::Marpa and linked to a long article he wrote about Lexing and Parsing with Marpa.

item.title: The 'Perl Tutorial' Tutorial
item.description: Joel Berger provides some directions how to select a good Perl tutorial. (one could, of course, just check out mine :-)

item.title: A Real Developer Challenge
item.description: Michael G Schwern describes how he thinks developers should be interview by potential employers. I am not sure if he talks from experience as an interviewer or as someone who is applying for a job. In either case interesting point.

item.title: HTML::ParseBrowser rides again
item.description: Neil Bowers describes the process of taking over maintenances of a CPAN module.

item.title: Why I Run Tests on Install
item.description: In response to an article by Jonathan Swartz arguing against running tests on installation, chromatic describes why he runs test and why he was looking for ways to improve the speed of testing. Being able to run the tests after installation would be nice and would be able to help in case we upgrade a dependency that breaks an already installed module.

item.title: Module releases and Test reports (A history of releases and perls)
item.description: Joseph Walton, author of XML::Writers takes the data from CPAN testers and shows some interesting graphs about the relation ship between the release dates of perl, XML::Writer and the respective test reports on CPAN Testers.

item.title: True + True == 2
item.description: 'don't assume the author is an idiot'. An obvious refactoring and an educational post goes wrong. There is a certain relaxing feeling that even people like Schwern can make mistakes sometimes.

item.title: udp_server with IO::Lambda
item.description: Dmitry Karasik shows and explains how to write a udp_server using his IO::Lambda module.

item.title: Perforce auth-check trigger for Unix passwd file
item.description: Small but useful script for Perforce users.

item.title: Barack Obama's coming to the DC-Baltimore Perl Workshop?
item.description: Tim Heaney (oylenshpeegul) uses Google::Directions to find out how could the president visit the workshop. I am quite sure he will have to pick an alternate route, now that the planned one was exposed to dangerous Perl Hackers.

item.title: Perl: When DWIM Doesn't
item.description: An article by Douglas from Shutterstock about two surprising features of Perl that can easily trip programmers. Some interesting comments included.

item.title: t1: Expressing integers using four nines
item.description: Moritz Lenz writes about the first task in the Perl 6 coding contest that ended recently.

item.title: Debugging Perl scripts
item.description: This is one of the first entries of the Perl Tutorial that gives some simple ideas how to debug Perl code.

item.title: Perl on the command line
item.description: While in most of the Perl tutorial I deal with scripts, here I give a small glimpse into the world of one-liners.

item.title: The right way to install CPAN modules
item.description: perlbrew? CPAN.pm ? cpanm? apt-get?

item.title: Perl Workshop in Israel
item.description: February 28, 2012, Ramat Gan, Israel

item.title: German Perl workshop
item.description: March 5-7, 2012, Erlangen, Germany

item.title: DC-Baltimore Perl workshop
item.description: April 14, 2012, Catonsville, MD, USA

item.title: YAPC::NA
item.description: June 13-15, 2012, Madison, Wisconsin, USA
